title: Questerre updates PX Energy transaction

summary: Questerre Energy Corporation (Queterre) has updated its proposed acquisition of Parana Xisto SA (PX Energy), a privately held oil shale production and refining company based in southern Brazil, by acquiring shares from its indirect parent companies, Forbes & Manhattan Resources Inc. (F&M Resources) and Forbes Participaҫões Ltda. Michael Binnion, President & Chief Executive Officer of Questerry, stated that the company's top priority is completing due diligence on the Acquisition to ensure an accretive transaction for shareholders. The completion of the Acquisition is subject to several conditions including satisfactory due diligence review, board approval, standard regulatory approvals, and third-party approvals. The company remains committed to collaborating with all stakeholders on a transaction that restores financial flexibility and establishes a viable path to realize its potential.
shortSummary: Questerre Energy Corporation updates its proposed acquisition of Parana Xisto SA, focusing on liquidity and sustainability, pending various regulatory approvals.
argos_summary: Questerre Energy Corp reports progress on its proposed acquisition of Brazil‑based oil shale producer Parana Xisto SA through the purchase of shares of its parent companies, Forbes & Manhattan Resources Inc. and Forbes Participações Ltda. Management confirms operational compliance and has identified a need for additional short‑ and long‑term liquidity, prompting ongoing talks with bondholders and convertible note holders. The company highlights the strategic value of PX Energy’s refining license and growth projects, while noting that the deal remains contingent on due diligence, board and regulatory approvals. Forward‑looking statements caution that the acquisition may not close and outline potential risks to the transaction and future performance.
